00017 package WeBWorK::URLPath;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::URLPath - the WeBWorK virtual URL heirarchy.
00022 
00023 =cut
00024 
00025 use strict;
00026 use warnings;
00027 use Carp;
00028 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00029 use WeBWorK::Localize;
00030 {
00031     no warnings "redefine";
00032     
00033     sub debug {
00034         my ($label, $indent, @message) = @_;
00035         my $header = " "x$indent;
00036         $header .= "$label: " if $label ne "";
00037         WeBWorK::Debug::debug($header, @message);
00038     }
00039 }
00040 
00041 =head1 VIRTUAL HEIRARCHY
00042 
00043 PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD UPDATE THIS IF YOU CHANGE THE HEIRARCHY BELOW!!!
00044 
00045  root                                /
00046  
00047  course_admin                        /admin/ -> logout, options, instructor_tools
00048  html2xml                            /html2xml/
00049  instructorXMLHandler                    /instructorXMLHandler/
00050  set_list                            /$courseID/
00051  
00052  equation_display                    /$courseID/equation/
00053  feedback                            /$courseID/feedback/
00054  gateway_quiz                        /$courseID/quiz_mode/$setID/
00055  proctored_gateway_quiz              /$courseID/proctored_quiz_mode/$setID/
00056  proctored_gateway_proctor_login     /$courseID/proctored_quiz_mode/$setID/proctor_login/
00057  grades                              /$courseID/grades/
00058  hardcopy                            /$courseID/hardcopy/
00059  hardcopy_preselect_set              /$courseID/hardcopy/$setID/
00060  logout                              /$courseID/logout/
00061  options                             /$courseID/options/
00062  #test                               /$courseID/test/
00063  #render                              /$courseID/render/
00064  
00065  instructor_tools                    /$courseID/instructor/
00066  
00067  instructor_user_list                /$courseID/instructor/users/
00068  instructor_user_detail              /$courseID/instructor/users/$userID/
00069  instructor_sets_assigned_to_user    /$courseID/instructor/users/$userID/sets/
00070  
00071  instructor_user_list2                /$courseID/instructor/users2/
00072  instructor_user_detail2              /$courseID/instructor/users2/$userID/ #not created yet
00073  instructor_sets_assigned_to_user2    /$courseID/instructor/users2/$userID/sets/ #not created yet
00074 
00075  
00076  instructor_set_list                 /$courseID/instructor/sets/
00077  instructor_set_detail               /$courseID/instructor/sets/$setID/
00078  instructor_users_assigned_to_set    /$courseID/instructor/sets/$setID/users/
00079  
00080  instructor_set_list2                 /$courseID/instructor/sets2/
00081  instructor_set_detail2               /$courseID/instructor/sets2/$setID/ #not created yet
00082  instructor_users_assigned_to_set2    /$courseID/instructor/sets2/$setID/users/ #not created yet
00083  
00084  instructor_add_users                /$courseID/instructor/add_users/
00085  instructor_set_assigner             /$courseID/instructor/assigner/
00086  instructor_file_transfer            /$courseID/instructor/files/
00087  instructor_file_manager             /$courseID/instructor/file_manager/
00088  instructor_set_maker                /$courseID/instructor/setmaker/
00089  instructor_set_maker2               /$courseID/instructor/setmaker2/
00090  instructor_set_maker3               /$courseID/instructor/setmaker3/
00091  instructor_get_target_set_problems  /$courseID/instructor/GetTargetSetProblems/
00092  instructor_get_library_set_problems /$courseID/instructor/GetLibrarySetProblems/
00093  instructor_config                   /$courseID/instructor/config/
00094  instructor_compare                  /$courseID/instructor/compare/
00095  
00096  instructor_problem_editor           /$courseID/instructor/pgProblemEditor/
00097  instructor_problem_editor_withset   /$courseID/instructor/pgProblemEditor/$setID/
00098  instructor_problem_editor_withset_withproblem
00099                                      /$courseID/instructor/pgProblemEditor/$setID/$problemID/
00100                                      
00101  instructor_problem_editor2           /$courseID/instructor/pgProblemEditor2/
00102  instructor_problem_editor2_withset   /$courseID/instructor/pgProblemEditor2/$setID/
00103  instructor_problem_editor2_withset_withproblem
00104                                      /$courseID/instructor/pgProblemEditor2/$setID/$problemID/
00105  
00106  instructor_scoring                  /$courseID/instructor/scoring/
00107  instructor_scoring_download         /$courseID/instructor/scoringDownload/
00108  instructor_mail_merge               /$courseID/instructor/send_mail/
00109  instructor_answer_log               /$courseID/instructor/show_answers/
00110  instructor_preflight               /$courseID/instructor/preflight/
00111  
00112  instructor_statistics               /$courseID/instructor/stats/
00113  instructor_set_statistics           /$courseID/instructor/stats/set/$setID/
00114  instructor_user_statistics          /$courseID/instructor/stats/student/$userID/
00115  
00116  instructor_progress                  /$courseID/instructor/StudentProgress/
00117  instructor_set_progress              /$courseID/instructor/StudentProgress/set/$setID/
00118  instructor_user_progress             /$courseID/instructor/StudentProgress/student/$userID/
00119  
00120  problem_list                        /$courseID/$setID/
00121  problem_detail                      /$courseID/$setID/$problemID/
00122

00125 ################################################################################
00126 # tree of path types

00128 
00129 our %pathTypes = (
00130     root => {
00131         name    => 'WeBWorK',
00132         parent  => '',
00133         kids    => [ qw/course_admin  html2xml instructorXMLHandler set_list / ],
00134         match   => qr|^/|,
00135         capture => [ qw// ],
00136         produce => '/',
00137         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Home',
00138     },
00139     course_admin => {
00140         name    => 'Course Administration',
00141         parent  => 'root',
00142         kids    => [ qw/logout options instructor_tools/ ],
00143         match   => qr|^(admin)/|,
00144         capture => [ qw/courseID/ ],
00145         produce => 'admin/',
00146         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::CourseAdmin',
00147     },
00148     
00149     ################################################################################
00150     html2xml => {
00151         name    => 'html2xml',
00152         parent  => 'root', #    'set_list',
00153         kids    => [ qw// ],
00154         match   => qr|^html2xml/|,
00155         capture => [ qw// ],
00156         produce => 'html2xml/',
00157         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::renderViaXMLRPC',
00158     },
00159     instructorXMLHandler => {
00160         name => 'instructorXMLHandler',
00161         parent => 'root',
00162         kids => [ qw// ],
00163         match   => qr|^instructorXMLHandler/|,
00164         capture => [ qw// ],
00165         produce => 'instructorXMLHandler/',
00166         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::instructorXMLHandler',
00167     },
00168     set_list => {
00169         name    => '$courseID',
00170         parent  => 'root',
00171         kids    => [ qw/equation_display feedback gateway_quiz proctored_gateway_quiz grades hardcopy
00172             logout options instructor_tools problem_list
00173         / ],
00174         match   => qr|^([^/]+)/|,
00175         capture => [ qw/courseID/ ],
00176         produce => '$courseID/',
00177         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::ProblemSets',
00178     },
00179

00563         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::SendMail',
00564     },
00565     instructor_answer_log => {
00566         name    => 'Answer Log',
00567         parent  => 'instructor_tools',
00568         kids    => [ qw// ],
00569         match   => qr|^show_answers/|,
00570         capture => [ qw// ],
00571         produce => 'show_answers/',
00572         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::ShowAnswers',
00573     },
00574     instructor_preflight => {
00575         name    => 'Preflight Log',
00576         parent  => 'instructor_tools',
00577         kids    => [ qw// ],
00578         match   => qr|^preflight/|,
00579         capture => [ qw// ],
00580         produce => 'preflight/',
00581         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Preflight',
00582     },

00584     ################################################################################
00585     
00586     instructor_statistics => {
00587         name    => 'Statistics',
00588         parent  => 'instructor_tools',
00589         kids    => [ qw/instructor_set_statistics instructor_user_statistics/ ],
00590         match   => qr|^stats/|,
00591         capture => [ qw// ],
00592         produce => 'stats/',
00593         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Stats',
00594     },

00597         parent  => 'instructor_statistics',

00600         capture => [ qw/statType setID/ ],
00601         produce => 'set/$setID/',
00602         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Stats',
00603     },

00609         capture => [ qw/statType userID/ ],
00610         produce => 'student/$userID/',

00620         match   => qr|^progress/|,
00621         capture => [ qw// ],
00622         produce => 'progress/',

00632         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::StudentProgress',

00641         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::StudentProgress',

00644     ################################################################################
00645     
00646     problem_list => {
00647         name    => '$setID',
00648         parent  => 'set_list',
00649         kids    => [ qw/problem_detail/ ],
00650         match   => qr|^([^/]+)/|,
00651         capture => [ qw/setID/ ],
00652         produce => '$setID/',
00653         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::ProblemSet',
00654     },

00657         parent  => 'problem_list',
00658         kids    => [ qw// ],
00659         match   => qr|^([^/]+)/|,

00662         display => 'WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Problem',
00663     },
00664     
00665 );
00666 
00667 =for comment
00668 
00669 a handy template:
00670 
00671     id => {
00672         name    => '',
00673         parent  => '',
00674         kids    => [ qw// ],
00675         match   => qr|^/|,
00676         capture => [ qw// ],
00677         produce => '',
00678         display => '',
00679     },
00680 
00681 =cut
00682 
00683 ################################################################################
00684 
00685 =head1 CONSTRUCTORS
00686 
00687 =over
00688 
00689 =item new(%fields)
00690 
00691 Creates a new WeBWorK::URLPath. %fields may contain the following:
00692 
00693  type => the internal path type associated with this 
00694  args => a reference to a hash associating path arguments with values
00695 
00696 This constructor is used internally. Refer to newFromPath() and newFromModule()
00697 for more useful constructors.
00698 
00699 =cut
00700 
00701 sub new {
00702     my ($invocant, %fields) = @_;
00703     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00704     my $self = {
00705         type => undef,
00706         r    => undef,             # will point to the parent request object (for access to the $ce)
00707         args => {},
00708         %fields,
00709     };
00710     return bless $self, $class;
00711 }
00712 
00713 =item newFromPath($path)
00714 
00715 Creates a new WeBWorK::URLPath by parsing the path given in $path. It the path
00716 is invalid, an exception is thrown.
00717 
00718 =cut
00719 
00720 sub newFromPath {
00721     my ($invocant,  $path, $r) = @_;
00722     
00723     my ($type, %args) = getPathType($path);
00724     croak "no type matches path $path" unless $type;
00725     croak "URLPath requires a request object parent as second element" unless (ref($r) =~/WeBWorK::Request/);
00726     
00727     return $invocant->new(
00728         type => $type,
00729         r    => $r,             # will point to the parent request object (for access to the $ce)
00730         args => \%args,
00731     );
00732 }
00733 
00734 =item newFromModule($module,  $r, %args)
00735 
00736 Creates a new WeBWorK::URLPath by finding a path type which matches the module
00737 and path arguments given. If no type matches, an exception is thrown.
00738 
00739 =cut
00740 
00741 sub newFromModule {
00742     my ($invocant, $module, $r, %args) = @_;
00743     
00744     my $type = getModuleType($module, keys %args);
00745     croak "URLPath requires a request object parent as second element" unless (ref($r) =~/WeBWorK::Request/);
00746     croak "no type matches module $module with args", map { " $_=>$args{$_}" } keys %args unless $type;
00747     
00748     return $invocant->new(
00749         type => $type,
00750         r    => $r,
00751         args => \%args
00752     );
00753 }
00754 
00755 =back
00756 
00757 =cut
00758 
00759 ################################################################################
00760 
00761 =head1 METHODS
00762 
00763 =head2 Methods that return information from the object itself
00764 
00765 =over
00766 
00767 =item type()
00768 
00769 Returns the path type of the WeBWorK::URLPath.
00770 
00771 =cut
00772 
00773 sub type {
00774     my ($self) = @_;
00775     my $type = $self->{type};
00776     
00777     return $type;
00778 }
00779 
00780 =item args()
00781 
00782 Returns a hash of arguments derived from the WeBWorK::URLPath.
00783 
00784 =cut
00785 
00786 sub args {
00787     my ($self) = @_;
00788     my %args = %{ $self->{args} };
00789     
00790     return %args;
00791 }
00792 
00793 =item arg($name)
00794 
00795 Returns the named argument, as derived from the WeBWorK::URLPath.
00796 
00797 =cut
00798 
00799 sub arg {
00800     my ($self, $name) = @_;
00801     my %args = %{ $self->{args} };
00802     
00803     return $args{$name};
00804 }
00805 
00806 =back
00807 
00808 =cut
00809 
00810 # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00811 
00812 =head2 Methods that return information from path node associated with the object
00813 
00814 =over
00815 
00816 =item name()
00817 
00818 Returns the human-readable name of this WeBWorK::URLPath.
00819 
00820 =cut
00821 
00822 sub name {
00823     my ($self) = @_;
00824     my $type = $self->{type};
00825     my %args = $self->args;
00826     
00827     my $name = $pathTypes{$type}->{name};
00828     $name = $self->{r}->maketext($name);   # translate the display name
00829     $name = interpolate($name, %args);
00830     
00831     return $name;
00832 }
00833 
00834 =item module()
00835 
00836 Returns the name of the module that will handle this WeBWorK::URLPath.
00837 
00838 =cut
00839 
00840 sub module {
00841     my ($self) = @_;
00842     my $type = $self->{type};
00843     
00844     return $pathTypes{$type}->{display};
00845 }
00846 
00847 =back
00848 
00849 =cut
00850 
00851 # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00852 
00853 =head2 Methods that search the virtual heirarchy
00854 
00855 =over
00856 
00857 =item parent()
00858 
00859 Returns a new WeBWorK::URLPath representing the parent of the current URLPath.
00860 Returns an undefined value if the URLPath has no parent.
00861 
00862 =cut
00863 
00864 sub parent {
00865     my ($self) = @_;
00866     my $type = $self->{type};
00867     
00868     my $newType = $pathTypes{$self->{type}}->{parent};
00869     return undef unless $newType;
00870     
00871     # remove any arguments added by the current node (and therefore not needed by the parent)
00872     my @currArgs = @{ $pathTypes{$type}->{capture} };
00873     my %newArgs = %{ $self->{args} };
00874     delete @newArgs{@currArgs} if @currArgs;
00875     # use the same request object "parent" for parent URLPath as for the child
00876     return $self->new(type => $newType, r => $self->{r}, args => \%newArgs);
00877 }
00878 
00879 =item child($module, %newArgs)
00880 
00881 Returns a new WeBWorK::URLPath representing the child of the current URLPath
00882 whose module is C<$module>. If no child matches, an undefined value is returned.
00883 Pass additional arguments needed by the child in C<%newArgs>.
00884 
00885 =cut
00886 
00887 sub child {
00888     my ($self, $module, %newArgs) = @_;
00889     my $type = $self->{type};
00890     
00891     my @kids = @{ $pathTypes{$type}->{kids} };
00892     my $newType;
00893     foreach my $kid (@kids) {
00894         if ($pathTypes{$kid}->{module} eq $module) {
00895             $newType = $kid;
00896             last;
00897         }
00898     }
00899     
00900     if ($newType) {
00901         return $self->new(type => $newType, args => \%newArgs);
00902     } else {
00903         return undef;
00904     }
00905 }
00906 
00907 =item path()
00908 
00909 Reconstructs the path string from a WeBWorK::URLPath.
00910 
00911 =cut
00912 
00913 sub path {
00914     my ($self) = @_;
00915     my $type = $self->type;
00916     my %args = %{ $self->{args} };
00917     
00918     my $path = buildPathFromType($type);
00919     $path = interpolate($path, %args);
00920     
00921     return $path;
00922 }
00923 
00924 =back
00925 
00926 =cut
00927 
00928 
00929 
00930 ################################################################################
00931 
00932 =head1 UTILITY FUNCTIONS
00933 
00934 =over
00935 
00936 =item all_modules()
00937 
00938 Return a list of the display modules associated with all possible path types.
00939 
00940 =cut
00941 
00942 sub all_modules {
00943     my @modules = grep { defined } map { $pathTypes{$_}{display} } keys %pathTypes;
00944     my %modules; @modules{@modules} = (); # remove duplicates
00945     return keys %modules;
00946 }
00947 
00948 =item interpolate($string, %symbols)
00949 
00950 Replaces simple scalars (\$\w+) in $string with values in %symbols. If a scalar
00951 does not exist in %symbols, it is left alone.
00952 
00953 =cut
00954 
00955 sub interpolate {
00956     my ($string, %symbols) = @_;
00957     
00958     $string =~ s/\$(\w+)/exists $symbols{$1} ? $symbols{$1} : "\$$1"/eg;
00959     
00960     return $string;
00961 }
00962 
00963 =back
00964 
00965 =cut
00966 
00967 # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00968 
00969 =over
00970 
00971 =item getPathType($path)
00972 
00973 Parse the string $path, determining the path type. Returns ($type, %args), where
00974 $type is the type of the path and %args contains any extracted path arguments.
00975 If conversion fails, a false value is returned.
00976 
00977 =cut
00978 
00979 sub getPathType($) {
00980     my ($path) = @_;
00981     
00982     my %args;
00983     my $context = visitPathTypeNode("root", $path, \%args, 0);
00984     
00985     return $context, %args;
00986 }
00987 
00988 =item getModuleType($module, @args)
00989 
00990 Returns the path type matching the given module and argument names, or a false
00991 value if no type matches.
00992 
00993 =cut
00994 
00995 sub getModuleType {
00996     my ($module, @args) = @_;
00997     @args = sort @args;
00998     my %args;
00999     @args{@args} = ();
01000     
01001     NODE: foreach my $nodeID (keys %pathTypes) {
01002         my $node = $pathTypes{$nodeID};
01003         
01004         # module name matches?
01005         next NODE unless defined $node->{display} and $node->{display} eq $module;
01006         
01007         # collect all captures from here to root
01008         my @captures;
01009         my $tmpNodeID = $nodeID;
01010         while ($tmpNodeID) {
01011             my $tmpNode = $pathTypes{$tmpNodeID};
01012             push @captures, @{ $tmpNode->{capture} };
01013             $tmpNodeID = $tmpNode->{parent};
01014         }
01015         
01016         # same number of captures?
01017         next NODE unless @captures == @args;
01018         
01019         # same captures?
01020         @captures = sort @captures;
01021         for (my $i = 0; $i < @args; $i++) {
01022             next NODE unless $args[$i] eq $captures[$i];
01023         }
01024         
01025         # if we got here, this node matches
01026         return $nodeID;
01027     }
01028     
01029     return 0; # no node matches
01030 }
01031 
01032 =item buildPathFromType($type)
01033 
01034 Returns a string path for the given path type. Since arguments are not supplied,
01035 the string may contain scalar variables ripe for interpolation.
01036 
01037 =cut
01038 
01039 sub buildPathFromType($) {
01040     my ($type) = @_;
01041     
01042     my $path = "";
01043     
01044     while ($type) {
01045         $path = $pathTypes{$type}->{produce} . $path;
01046         $type = $pathTypes{$type}->{parent};
01047     };
01048     
01049     return $path;
01050 }
01051 
01052 =item visitPathTypeNode($nodeID, $path, $argsRef, $indent)
01053 
01054 Internal search function. See getPathType().
01055 
01056 Returns the nodeID of the node that consumed the final characters in $path, or
01057 the following failure conditions:
01058 
01059 Returns 0 if $nodeID doesn't match $path.
01060 
01061 Returns -1 if $nodeID matched $path, but no children of $nodeID consumed the
01062 remaining path. In this case, the stack is unwound immediately.
01063 
01064 =cut
01065 
01066 sub visitPathTypeNode($$$$);
01067 
01068 sub visitPathTypeNode($$$$) {
01069     my ($nodeID, $path, $argsRef, $indent) = @_;
01070     debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "visiting node $nodeID with path $path");
01071     
01072     unless (exists $pathTypes{$nodeID}) {
01073         debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "node $nodeID doesn't exist in node list: failed");
01074         die "node $nodeID doesn't exist in node list: failed";
01075     }
01076     
01077     my %node = %{ $pathTypes{$nodeID} };
01078     my $match = $node{match};
01079     my @capture_names = @{ $node{capture} };
01080     
01081     # attempt to match $path against $match.
01082     debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "trying to match $match: ");
01083     if ($path =~ s/($match)//) {
01084         # it matches! store captured strings in $argsRef and remove the matched
01085         # characters from $path. waste a lot of lines on sanity checking... ;)
01086         debug("", 0, "success!");
01087         my @capture_values = $1 =~ m/$match/;
01088         if (@capture_names) {
01089             my $nexpected = @capture_names;
01090             my $ncaptured = @capture_values;
01091             my $max = $nexpected > $ncaptured ? $nexpected : $ncaptured;
01092             warn "captured $ncaptured arguments, expected $nexpected." unless $ncaptured == $nexpected;
01093             for (my $i = 0; $i < $max; $i++) {
01094                 my $name = $capture_names[$i];
01095                 my $value = $capture_values[$i];
01096                 if ($i > $nexpected) {
01097                     warn "captured an unexpected argument: $value -- ignoring it.";
01098                     next;
01099                 }
01100                 if ($i > $ncaptured) {
01101                     warn "expected an uncaptured argument named: $name -- ignoring it.";
01102                     next;
01103                 }
01104                 if (exists $argsRef->{$name}) {
01105                     my $old = $argsRef->{$name};
01106                     warn "encountered argument $name again, old value: $old new value: $value -- replacing.";
01107                 }
01108                 debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "setting argument $name => $value.");
01109                 $argsRef->{$name} = $value;
01110             }
01111         }
01112     } else {
01113         # it doesn't match. bail out now with return value 0
01114         debug("", 0, "failed.");
01115         return 0;
01116     }
01117     
01118     ##### if we're here we matched #####
01119     
01120     # if there's no more path left, then this node is the one! return $nodeID
01121     if ($path eq "") {
01122         debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "no path left, type is $nodeID");
01123         return $nodeID;
01124     }
01125     
01126     # otherwise, we have to send the remaining path to the node's children
01127     debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "but path remains: $path");
01128     my @kids = @{ $node{kids} };
01129     if (@kids) {
01130         foreach my $kid (@kids) {
01131             debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "trying child $kid:");
01132             my $result = visitPathTypeNode($kid, $path, $argsRef, $indent+1);
01133             # we return in two situations:
01134             # if $result is -1, then the kid matched but couldn't consume the rest of the path
01135             # if $result is the ID of a node, then the kid matched and consumed the rest of the path
01136             # these are all true values (assuming that "0" isn't a valid node ID), so we say:
01137             return $result if $result;
01138         }
01139         debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "no children claimed the remaining path: failed.");
01140     } else {
01141         debug("visitPathTypeNode", $indent, "no children to claim the remaining path: failed.");
01142     }
01143     
01144     # in both of the above cases, we matched but couldn't provide children that
01145     # would consume the rest of the path. so we return -1, causing the whole
01146     # stack to unwind. WHEEEEEEE!
01147     return -1;
01148 }
01149 
01150 =back
01151 
01152 =cut
01153 
01154 1;
